This forms a closed loop. 4. *Loop 4 - Circular hole 3*: Draw a circle centered at point [0.5521, 0.2382] and with a radius of 0.0445. This forms a closed loop. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by a distance of 0.0095 towards the normal, and another 0.0095 in the opposite direction of the normal. Apply a scale factor of 0.75. Final result This process creates a 3D model of a rectangular prism with four circular holes on its surface, as described in the final shape property. *Shape*: A 3D model of a rectangular prism with four circular holes on its surface. *Length*: 0.75 meters. *Width*: 0.0191 meters. *Height*: 0.75 meters.</description>

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vectors. 4. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0242 units towards the normal to create the final 3D shape. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, standing upright Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, standing upright.
